meanings.definition: To pay out money, especially from a fund or account.
meanings.sent1: The charity disbursed funds to help the homeless in our community.
meanings.sent2: The company disbursed salaries to its employees at the end of the month.
meanings.sent3: The magician disbursed coins from his hat, much to the delight of the children.
meanings.sent4: The sun disbursed its golden rays across the horizon, painting the sky in hues of orange and pink.
meanings.sent5: The teacher disbursed knowledge to her students, eager to see them learn and grow.

meanings.sent1: The wind disbursed the leaves all over the yard.
meanings.sent2: The farmer disbursed seeds across the field for planting.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel disbursed acorns in the garden, causing a playful mess.
meanings.sent4: The artist disbursed colors on the canvas, creating a vibrant masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The children disbursed toys around the room, turning it into a playful wonderland.
